full_text: In this demo, we create a new underwriting rule for drivers over 80. It should be evaluated before quote time, and no quote should be provided if the condition is true. The approval will expire after one year by default. First login as superuser. Go to Administration. Select Business Settings, Business Rules, Underwriting Rules. Click Add. Enter the required fields to define the rule on the Rule Details tab. The code must be unique. Take pre-quote as the checking set since it should be evaluated before quote. Select Block Quote for blocking point. Select 1 year for default duration after the underwriting issue is approved. Enter the description. Go to the Advanced tab. Set the fields related to approving the issue. Select at most for value comparator, so that you can set a upper limit in the underwriting authority for this underwriting issue type. Select age as the value formatter type. Select Fixed as the default value assignment type, so that the driver's age is used directly to be compared with the user's underwriting authority limit. Go back to the rule details page. Go back to the Rule Details page. In the Applies to section, click Selected for policy lines. Select Personal Auto and click the right arrow to move it to the selected list on the right. Select the Rule Context Personal Auto policy, for each driver, which provides data objects to the drivers on the policy. Next, set up the condition that raises the underwriting issue. Click in the Expression field. The list of available objects are displayed for the selected rule context. Select the object PIA driver. Type a dot to show the fields on the object. Select age. In the Operation drop-down, select the greater than sign. In the Write Expression field, type in the number 80. Next, set underwriting issue details. Use the syntax of $ and curly braces to wrap the policy objects. The fixed ID of the driver object is unique, so it can be used as the issue key to identify the underwriter issue once it is raised. Use the driver's age as the value of the underwriting issue. Enter the short description for the underwriting issue for all languages. Enter the long description for the underwriting issue. Enter the rule. Save the rule. Log out. Log in as a producer Archie Armstrong. Create a personal auto submission with a driver of Rady. We have prepared one as an example. Driver Tom Newton is 84 years old. Try to quote. The issue driver over 80 is raised, and it blocks quote. Go to risk analysis. The age is displayed with the issue, because we configured the underwriting rule to record the value. The Approve button is grayed out because the user does not have the authority. We will discuss authority profile in a separate demonstration. The Filogy of the !

segments.text: In this demo, we create a new underwriting rule for drivers over 80. It should be evaluated before quote time, and no quote should be provided if the condition is true. The approval will expire after one year by default. First login as superuser. Go to Administration. Select Business Settings, Business Rules, Underwriting Rules. Click Add.

Enter the required fields to define the rule on the Rule Details tab. The code must be unique. Take pre-quote as the checking set since it should be evaluated before quote. Select Block Quote for blocking point.
Select 1 year for default duration after the underwriting issue is approved. Enter the description. Go to the Advanced tab. Set the fields related to approving the issue.
Select at most for value comparator, so that you can set a upper limit in the underwriting authority for this underwriting issue type.
Select age as the value formatter type.
Select Fixed as the default value assignment type, so that the driver's age is used directly to be compared with the user's underwriting authority limit.
Go back to the rule details page.
Go back to the Rule Details page.
In the Applies to section, click Selected for policy lines.
Select Personal Auto and click the right arrow to move it to the selected list on the right.
Select the Rule Context Personal Auto policy, for each driver, which provides data objects to the drivers on the policy.
Next, set up the condition that raises the underwriting issue. Click in the Expression field.
The list of available objects are displayed for the selected rule context. Select the object PIA driver.
Type a dot to show the fields on the object.
Select age.
In the Operation drop-down, select the greater than sign.
In the Write Expression field, type in the number 80.
Next, set underwriting issue details.
Use the syntax of $ and curly braces to wrap the policy objects.
The fixed ID of the driver object is unique, so it can be used as the issue key to identify the underwriter issue once it is raised.
Use the driver's age as the value of the underwriting issue.
Enter the short description for the underwriting issue for all languages.
Enter the long description for the underwriting issue.
Enter the rule.
Save the rule.
Log out.
Log in as a producer Archie Armstrong.
Create a personal auto submission with a driver of Rady.
We have prepared one as an example.
Driver Tom Newton is 84 years old.
Try to quote.
The issue driver over 80 is raised, and it blocks quote.
Go to risk analysis.
The age is displayed with the issue, because we configured the underwriting rule to record the value.
The Approve button is grayed out because the user does not have the authority.
We will discuss authority profile in a separate demonstration.
